alert.note: Alert for Martin; Midland (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 09 at 10:44PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Midland and central Martin Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1044 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong cluster of thunderstorms near Lenorah, or 16 miles southwest of Ackerly, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Midland, Greenwood, Lenorah, Tarzan, Courtney and Midland Airpark. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 143 and 154. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
